detaileddescription.para:
Wrapper for Csm function CsmPi_RandomSeedStart, responsible for requesting the initialization of the Random state which has been given in the passed configuration. The state initialization function of the configured primitive is called and its return value is returned.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
Std_ReturnType CSMPI_E_OK - seeding start was successfully requested CSMPI_E_BUSY - another service of Random is already running
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_Rte_Call_WFS_CsmRandomSeed_RandomSeedStart
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_L3_WFS_151

Wrapper for Csm function CsmPi_RandomSeedUpdate responsible for requesting the seeding of the Random state which has been given with in passed configuration. The seeding function of the configured primitive is called and its return value is returned.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
const
uint8* seedBuffer - a pointer to the start of an array which contains the seed uint32 seedLength - length of the seed array
Std_ReturnType CSMPI_E_OK - seeding update was successfully requested CSMPI_E_BUSY - another service of Random is already running CSMPI_E_NOT_OK - no seeding has been started yet
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_Rte_Call_WFS_CsmRandomSeed_RandomSeedUpdate
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_L3_WFS_151

reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous Security Relevance

Wrapper for Csm function CsmPi_SymKeyExtractUpdate responsible for requesting the update of the symmetric key extraction for the given data. The update function of the configured primitive is called and its return value is returned.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
const
uint8* dataBuffer - a pointer to the start of an array which contains a part of the key which should be extracted uint32 dataLength - amount of bytes of data
Std_ReturnType CSMPI_E_OK - update was successfully requested CSMPI_E_NOT_OK - no symmetric key extraction has been started yet CSMPI_E_BUSY - main function is processing a requested service at the moment
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_Rte_Call_WFS_CsmSymKeyExtract_SymKeyExtractUpdate
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_L3_WFS_151

Wrapper for Csm function CsmPi_SymKeyExtractFinish responsible for requesting the finishing of the symmetric key extraction and the storing of the key in the given buffer. The finish function of the configured primitive is called and its return value is returned.

simplesect.para: reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: dataBuffer - a pointer to the buffer where the extracted key should be stored

simplesect.para: Std_ReturnType CSMPI_E_OK - finish was successfully requested CSMPI_E_NOT_OK - no symmetric key extraction has been started yet CSMPI_E_BUSY - main function is processing a requested service at the moment

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on: TEST_Rte_Call_WFS_CsmSymKeyExtract_SymKeyExtractFinish

detaileddescription.para:
Wrapper for Csm function CsmPi_RandomGenerate responsible for requesting the generation of pseudo random bytes. The byte generation function of the configured primitive is called and its return value is returned.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
uint8*
resultBuffer - a pointer to the start of a buffer where the generated pseudo random bytes should be stored uint32 resultLength - olds the amount of bytes which should be generated
Std_ReturnType CSMPI_E_OK - byte generation was successfully requested CSMPI_E_BUSY - another service of the Random is already running
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_Rte_Call_WFS_CsmRandomGenerate_RandomGenerate
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
EA_GUID of relebant archictecture_decision will have to be updated when new version of SW Archiecture will be available

memberdef.argsstring: (const CsmPi_SymKeyType *key, const uint8 *plainTextBuffer, uint32 plainTextLength, uint8 *cipherTextBuffer, uint32 *cipherTextLength)
memberdef.name: Rte_Call_WFS_CsmSymBlockEncrypt_SymBlockEncrypt

detaileddescription.para:
Wrapper for Csm function CsmPi_SymBlockEncrypt responsible for the symmetrical block encryption computation for the given data.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
const
CsmPi_SymKeyType* key - a pointer to the key which should be used in the symmetrical block encryption computation const uint8* plainTextBuffer - pointer to the start of an array which contains the constant plain text that shall be encrypted uint32 plainTextLength - length of the constant plain text in bytes uint8* cipherTextBuffer - a pointer to the start of an array where the encrypted text will be stored uint32* cipherTextLength - holds a pointer to a memory location in which the length information is stored. On calling this function this parameter shall contain the size of the buffer provided by cipherTextPtr.
Std_ReturnType CSMPI_E_OK - symmetrical block encryption computation finished with success CSMPI_E_BUSY - service of the symmetrical block encryption computation is already running CSMPI_E_NOT_OK - symmetrical block encryption computation failed
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_Rte_Call_WFS_CsmSymBlockEncrypt_SymBlockEncrypt
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
EA_GUID of relebant archictecture_decision will have to be updated when new version of SW Archiecture will be available

const

detaileddescription.para:
Wrapper for Csm function CsmPi_SymEncrypt responsible for the symmetrical encryption computation for the given data.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
const
CsmPi_SymKeyType* key - a pointer to the key which should be used in the symmetrical encryption computation const uint8* InitVectorBuffer - holds a pointer to the key which has to be used during the symmetrical encryption computation uint32 InitVectorLength - holds the length of the initialisation vector which has to be used during the symmetrical encryption computation const uint8* plainTextBuffer - a pointer to the start of an array which contains the constant plain text that shall be encrypted uint32* plainTextLength - length of the constant plain text in bytes uint8* cipherTextBuffer - a pointer to the start of an array where the encrypted text will be stored uint32* cipherTextLength - holds a pointer to a memory location in which the length information is stored.
Std_ReturnType CSMPI_E_OK - symmetrical encryption computation finished with success CSMPI_E_BUSY - service of the symmetrical encryption computation is already running CSMPI_E_NOT_OK - symmetrical encryption computation failed
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method

Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement

Wrapper for Csm function CsmPi_SymKeyExtract responsible for executing a synchronous nonstreaming symmetric key extraction for the given configuration. The synchronous function of the configured primitive is called and its return value is returned.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
const
uint8* dataBuffer - a pointer to the start of an array which contains a part of the key which should be extracted uint32 dataLength - the amount of bytes of data CsmPi_SymKeyType* key - a pointer to the buffer where the extracted key should be stored
Std_ReturnType CSMPI_E_OK - function was successfully requested CSMPI_E_NOT_OK - symmetric key extraction has been unsuccesfull CSMPI_E_BUSY - other request is processing a requested service at the moment
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_Rte_Call_WFS_CsmSymKeyExtract_SymKeyExtract
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:

briefdescription.para: The unit, collecting functions responsible for communication between Csm (Crypto Service Manager) and WFS library.
